page.title: 01RESUME OF COITY AND PENCOED
page.content:
This is a predominantly a rural area, gently undulating with some woodland. The highest land, lying to the north, is mostly common land providing rough grazing for sheep and cattle. The more fertile south supports several farms, mainly sheep or cattle, with some arrable. There is no industry. PENCOED: Largest centre of population, comprehensive and primary school; shopping centre. COITY: Village; primary school
post office & shop. Church & castle of Norman origin. HENDRE: Hamlet- farm & small holdings. PENYRHEOL: Hamlet-bus service & farm. BY EASTWOOD:Hamlet -farm & small holdings.
